item.title: What is wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Substring does what its name is. It created a sub string (part of a string) starting at the index you give it.

Read full topic

item.title: What is wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

The command is strung as admin, which is 5 letters, add the space, that’s 6, command.substring(6);
Its the the substring of the command, if your command is 15 letters long, with a space added its command.substring(16);

Read full topic

item.title: What is wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @daxter852 daxter852
item.description:
@daxter852 wrote:

deathschaos9:

The substring should be 6 not 4.

Yes, that worked like a charm. Thank you very much. I’m a little curious to find out what the difference between substring 6 and 4? What is substring anyways?

Read full topic

item.title: What is wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @sexy_slay sexy slay
item.description:
@sexy_slay wrote:

This code makes it so that anyone that is an owner can make administrators but i guess its worth a try, to look off of:

[code] }

    if (command.startsWith("admin") && playerRights >= 3) {
        String name = command.substring(10);

        try {
            int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name);
            client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p];

            c.playerRights = 2;
            c.savemoreinfo();
            c.savechar();
            c.disconnected = true;
            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (name + " is now an Administrator");
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sM(name + " either isn't online or doesn't exist");
        }[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: What is wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @daxter852 daxter852
item.description:
@daxter852 wrote:

if (command.startsWith("admin") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Johnny")) { String name = command.substring(4); try { int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name); client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p]; c.sM("You have been made Administrator by "+playerName+". Log out to see changes."); c.playerRights = 2; savegame(true); sM("You just made "+command.substring(4)+" Modarator."); } catch(Exception e) { sM(name+" either isn't online or doesn't exist"); } }
Whenever I use this command, I get a message saying “n [aplayersname] either isn’t online or doesn’t exist.”? I’m using delta source.

Read full topic
